programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Hitler's plans to invade the US using battleships, long-range bombers and secret infiltrators. Plus, a look at support for the Nazi movement in America during the 1940s.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Heinrich Himmler, the book-loving loner whose strange mystical beliefs drove him to carry out the most shocking act of genocide in human history.

programme.title: Waterloo Dead
programme.desc: Two hundred years after the Battle of Waterloo, investigators Tim Sutherland, Malin Holst and Simon Richardson employ forensic techniques to uncover surprising secrets from one of the greatest military encounters of all time.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo and Harry's professional rivalry erupts following Sam's departure. They deal with the case of several children who experienced unexplained breathing difficulties, leaving one of them dead. While Harry believes this was mass hysteria, Leo suspects something more sinister. Meanwhile, a man is found dead in his car with a stab wound to the chest. Tom Ward and William Gaminara star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An armed robbery case leads Phil Hunter and Jo Masters to the door of petty criminal Gareth Dickson, who is making and selling firearms so shoddy they are a danger to the user - as his eight-year-old nephew seems keen to prove. Gina Gold gets a warm welcome back at Sun Hill, but for Sheelagh Murphy the return to work following the death of fiance David Kent brings a crisis of confidence and a confession she's thinking of resigning.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch rescue a man trapped in an industrial chimney trying to rescue a cat, and avert tragedy when a caravan collapses.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five cinema workers from East Anglia, known collectively as the Popcorn Sweepers, answer questions based on top 10 lists, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round on subjects that include film, pop music, sport and food and drink. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Freeze Out
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a giant game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of £10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: That's So Magic
programme.desc: Keep it here on Magic for all your favourite videos from the biggest artists ever.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of Kamaz trucks and hair-care products and the construction of Chinese landmark building the Canton Tower.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a rust-free Triumph Stag, a task that proves much more difficult than he first thought - and when he eventually finds a car for Edd China, the mechanic has to perform repairs on a tight budget to keep a profit in sight.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While free-styling in Virginia's Appalachian Mountains, 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz come across a hideaway filled with history - and even some mementos from a bluegrass legend.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team heads to Hunter Mountain for fun and games on the slopes, while the bike set for auction is sent to be painted and powder-coated.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Construction crews in Bethel race to complete Era's newest hangar before the winter snow arrives, but when Jim turns up to inspect their progress, he is less than impressed.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits Miami to recover and crush abandoned boats, before heading to San Francisco to collect and recycle used mattresses.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes involved in the making of individual transporters, post clocks and drum heads.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The science and technology behind the manufacture of air bags, jelly beans and domestic water heaters, and how these methods have evolved over time.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents investigating the death of a New York petrol station mogul infiltrate the crime ring responsible and discover a Mafia world of brutality and murder.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Tyre marks and fibres snare a murderer who stabbed two women, and a man stages an 'accident' to kill his wife.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When 12-year-old Alajawan Brown is shot dead outside a shop in Washington, near to an earlier shooting, police refer to CCTV to see if the two are connected. S5/14/16.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of Michael and Valerie Miller, shot dead in the kitchen of their Maine home in November 2009. Nathaniel Nightingale, a friend of the couple's son, claimed his gun went off by accident when he shot Michael Miller, and that he shot Valerie in panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A land developer's wife goes missing, and investigators soon become suspicious of an overly helpful neighbour.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Houston SPCA Investigator Barbra Christiansen responds to a call involving what sounds like a serious case of cat overcrowding - one house and 35 cats.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A mini pig who loves to dig is in trouble with local authorities, a homeless shih-tzu cross is in a critical condition, and a baby cheetah must pass a series of tests.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori tries to find a dress for a bossy bridesmaid, while Summer wants a gown that is over her budget.
